Column Comment.0: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.1: FACILITY TYPE: The type of facility that is described in this row of data, such aspipeline, tank, battery etc. Please note that FACILITY_TYPE will eventually becomea SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.2: MAINTENANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a facility maintenance event.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: ACTUAL COMPLETED DATE: The date that this maintenance was actuallycompleted.
Column Comment.5: ACTUAL START DATE: The date that this maintenance actually started.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.8: MAINTENANCE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thebusiness associate who completed this maintenance.
Column Comment.9: MAINTAINENCE TYPE: the type of maintenace that will be done on this supportfacility, such as repaving, painting, surfacing etc.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: narrative remarks aobut this maintenance.
Column Comment.12: SCHEDULED COMPLETE DATE: The date that this maintenance is scheduled to becompleted.
Column Comment.13: SCHEDULED START DATE: the date that this maintenance is scheduled to occur.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
